title: Everything Salmon Sheet Pan Dinner Recipe
description: Delicate salmon with a crunchy topping is paired with tender potatoes and broccoli drizzled with a sweet and spicy mustard glaze in this simple, 30-minute sheet pan dinner.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Sheet Pan Dinner Recipes Everything Salmon Sheet Pan Dinner 4.8 (35) 29 Reviews 5 Photos Delicate salmon with a crunchy topping is paired with tender potatoes and broccoli drizzled with a sweet and spicy mustard glaze in this simple, 30-minute sheet pan dinner. The whole family will love the indulgent taste of this nutritious meal! Submitted by NicoleMcmom Updated on November 22, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings cooking spray 2 medium sweet potatoes, sliced into 1/4-inch wedges 1 tablespoon olive oil ½ teaspoon kosher salt, divided ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper, divided ¼ cup Dijon mustard 2 tablespoons honey ¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper 5 cups broccoli florets 4 (5 ounce) salmon fillets 2 tablespoons everything bagel seasoning 2 teaspoons soy sauce Directions Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with foil and coat lightly with cooking spray. Toss sweet potatoes with 2 teaspoons oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper in medium bowl. Place on one half of the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 5 minutes. While the potatoes are cooking, stir together Dijon, honey, and cayenne in a small bowl. Toss broccoli with remaining oil, salt, and pepper in a separate bowl. Remove potatoes from the oven. Add salmon to the other half of the baking sheet. Place 2 teaspoons of the mustard mixture on each salmon filet; brush evenly to coat, then sprinkle evenly with bagel seasoning. Add broccoli to the sweet potatoes. Return to the oven and bake until salmon flakes easily with a fork and the veggies are golden, about 12 minutes. Stir soy sauce into the remaining mustard mixture and drizzle over veggies. Allrecipes Editor's Note: Please note differences in ingredient amounts and total time when following the magazine version of this recipe. Add Your Photo Photos of Everything Salmon Sheet Pan Dinner 01 of 05 Photo by  Allrecipes 02 of 05 Photo by  CoolToast9644 03/19/2023 03 of 05 Photo by  Jennifer Hart 01/16/2023 Made it mostly as written and it was delicious!!! I never measure things, so guessed on spices. Timing for the cooking maybe a bit off. I cooked salmon and broccoli for 15. Next time I will cook sweet potatoes for 8, and then add other two ingredients for another 15-16. Gonna keep this recipe close at hand.... 04 of 05 Photo by  Allrecipes Magazine 10/14/2022 05 of 05 Photo by  AllrecipesPhoto 02/23/2021 1 You’ll Also Love Simple Seafood Sheet Pan Meal 4 Ratings Sheet Pan Salmon and Bell Pepper Dinner 35 Ratings Salmon Foil-Pack Dinner 12 Ratings Firecracker Salmon 3 Ratings Greek Sheet Pan Salmon and Asparagus 3 Ratings Tomato Basil Salmon 315 Ratings Spicy Hot Pepper Salmon 2 Ratings Jason's Salmon Florentine 7 Ratings Marinated Wild Salmon 143 Ratings Panko Parmesan Salmon 38 Ratings Curry Salmon with Mango 8 Ratings Healthy Dijon Salmon for One 2 Ratings Easy, No-Mess Baked Salmon 25 Ratings Wasabi Mayo Salmon 140 Ratings Easy Brazilian Spiced Salmon 5 Ratings Citrus Baked Fish 27 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. instructions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with foil and coat lightly with cooking spray.;Toss sweet potatoes with 2 teaspoons oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper in medium bowl. Place on one half of the prepared baking sheet.;Bake in the preheated oven for 5 minutes.;While the potatoes are cooking, stir together Dijon, honey, and cayenne in a small bowl. Toss broccoli with remaining oil, salt, and pepper in a separate bowl.;Remove potatoes from the oven. Add salmon to the other half of the baking sheet. Place 2 teaspoons of the mustard mixture on each salmon filet; brush evenly to coat, then sprinkle evenly with bagel seasoning. Add broccoli to the sweet potatoes. Return to the oven and bake until salmon flakes easily with a fork and the veggies are golden, about 12 minutes.;Stir soy sauce into the remaining mustard mixture and drizzle over veggies.
